016package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day6;
017
018import static com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.Presentation.NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT;
019
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.stream.Collectors;
023
024/**
025 * Implements a solution to the day 6 problem, which requires finding the number of integers in the
026 * domain of a quadratic expression for which the expression has a positive value. The only
027 * distinction between parts 1 and 2 is the input data; in this implementation, this data is taken
028 * from a {@code long[][]} constructor parameter.
029 *
030 * @see <a href="https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/6">"Day 6: Wait For It"</a>.
031 */
032public class WaitForIt {
033
034  private static final long[][] separateRaces =
035      new long[][]{{46, 358}, {68, 1054}, {98, 1807}, {66, 1080}};
036  private static final long[][] joinedRaces = new long[][]{{46689866, 358105418071080L}};
037
038  private final List<long[]> raceTimesAndDistances;
039
040  /**
041   * Initializes this instance with specified pairs of time &amp; distance values. In each nested
042   * array, the first element is the time limit for a race, while the second is the stated record
043   * distance for the race.
044   *
045   * @param raceTimesAndDistances Paired time &amp; distance values.
046   */
047  public WaitForIt(long[][] raceTimesAndDistances) {
048    this.raceTimesAndDistances = Arrays.stream(raceTimesAndDistances).toList();
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of {@link WaitForIt} with the relevant data,
053   * invokes the {@link #countWinningCombinations()}, and prints the result.
054   *
055   * @param args Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
056   */
057  public static void main(String[] args) {
058    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 1,
059        new WaitForIt(separateRaces).countWinningCombinations());
060    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 2,
061        new WaitForIt(joinedRaces).countWinningCombinations());
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Counts the number of integral values of <em>x</em> in each race, for which the inequality
066   * <em>x</em>(<em>T - x</em>) &gt; <em>D</em> holds (where <em>T</em> is the time limit for the
067   * race, and <em>D</em> is the stated distance record), then computes and returns the product of
068   * these counts.
069   * <p>Implementation notes: Rather than iterating across the range 0..<em>T</em> and testing the
070   * above inequality for each value, the quadratic formula is used to identify the endpoints of the
071   * range of values for which the inequality holds in each race.</p>
072   */
073  public long countWinningCombinations() {
074    return raceTimesAndDistances
075        .stream()
076        .mapToLong((pair) -> countWins(pair[0], pair[1]))
077        .reduce(1, (a, b) -> a * b);
078  }
079
080  private long countWins(long time, long distanceRecord) {
081    long count = 0;
082    long discriminantSquared = time * time - 4 * distanceRecord;
083    if (discriminantSquared >= 0) {
084      double discriminant = Math.sqrt(discriminantSquared);
085      long lowerRoot = (long) Math.floor((time - discriminant) / 2.0) + 1;
086      long upperRoot = (long) Math.ceil((time + discriminant) / 2.0) - 1;
087      count = upperRoot - lowerRoot + 1;
088    }
089    return count;
090  }
091
092}
